{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3730161,"name":"David","username":"DavidMasin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/davidmasin/{size}/205339_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-03T16:40:12.510Z","cooked":"

We’ve seen that there was a beta release for teh radio a few days ago and we decided to try it out.
I was wondering about the purpose of DIP switch 3. The beta release notes say, “Removed 2.4 GHz DIP Switch functionality”. Does DIP 3 still do anything in this version, or is it now unused?
Is there a release date for the beta? It’s working great for us so far.

Edit: forgot to add a link to the beta release and notes:
https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/advanced-topics/beta-release-candidates

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-09-03T17:34:25.542Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":310,"readers_count":309,"score":147.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":505922,"topic_slug":"vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions","display_username":"David","primary_group_name":"FUN","flair_name":"FUN","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/3/5/3523e759b0af37a7757142a8b2aa79b31f1a47c4.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":60,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/advanced-topics/beta-release-candidates","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Beta / Release Candidates | FIRST FRC Radio","clicks":19}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52686,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions/505922/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3730226,"name":"tkchan","username":"tkchan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/ee59a6/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-03T17:16:48.877Z","cooked":"

this is prior to this beta you are referring to. DIP Switch #3 is used to set the Radio’s 2.4GHz to allow it to act as AP in the AP mode programming - https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/programming-your-radio-at-home

My understanding is that DIP #3 must be in the OFF position for any Event FMS (I could be wrong since I’ve never used this switch myself).

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-09-03T17:16:48.877Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":292,"readers_count":291,"score":63.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":505922,"topic_slug":"vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions","display_username":"tkchan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/programming-your-radio-at-home","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26389,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"think outside of the box from time to time"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions/505922/2","custom_user_title":"think outside of the box from time to time","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3730236,"name":"Tauseef Afraz","username":"TFM110","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tfm110/{size}/197758_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-03T17:26:57.927Z","cooked":"
DavidMasin:

beta release

Here’s the release notes for the beta:
https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/advanced-topics/beta-release-candidates

Removed 2.4 GHz DIP Switch functionality

Added “Enable 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi” configuration option

I think this is fine. They didn’t remove the 2.4 GHz feature at all. It’s just software controlled now.

My assumption is because teams don’t actually turn off the 2.4 GHz at events, so instead of having to worry about turning it off, when you program your radio at the event, the kiosk will turn it off for you.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-09-03T17:26:57.927Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":270,"readers_count":269,"score":89.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":505922,"topic_slug":"vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions","display_username":"Tauseef Afraz","primary_group_name":"Swyft-Robotics","flair_name":"FUN","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/3/5/3523e759b0af37a7757142a8b2aa79b31f1a47c4.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":60,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/advanced-topics/beta-release-candidates","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":19}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39084,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC5431AM | FRC5790M| FUN | SWYFT"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions/505922/4","custom_user_title":"FRC5431AM | FRC5790M| FUN | SWYFT","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3730238,"name":"David","username":"DavidMasin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/davidmasin/{size}/205339_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-03T17:31:07.369Z","cooked":"

Yeah I saw these notes and understood that 2.4GHz doesn’t go away for now.

I was wondering if there was a purpose for the DIP 3 for v2.0.0 and beyond since it’s only action, for my knowledge, was used to enable/disable 2.4 GHz comms but now its not the case anymore
(Maybe a new feature / current feature, enable/disable switch?)

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-09-03T17:32:01.808Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":234,"readers_count":233,"score":61.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":505922,"topic_slug":"vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions","display_username":"David","primary_group_name":"FUN","flair_name":"FUN","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/3/5/3523e759b0af37a7757142a8b2aa79b31f1a47c4.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":60,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":39084,"username":"TFM110","name":"Tauseef Afraz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tfm110/{size}/197758_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52686,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions/505922/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3730383,"name":"MetabolicCloth","username":"MetabolicCloth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/metaboliccloth/{size}/9335_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-03T21:07:49.313Z","cooked":"

It was also annoying having to access the back side of the radio to toggle it once we had it bolted into its mount. Although some of that blame can probably go to us for how we chose to secure our radio.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-09-03T21:07:49.313Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":205,"readers_count":204,"score":41.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":505922,"topic_slug":"vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions","display_username":"MetabolicCloth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":39084,"username":"TFM110","name":"Tauseef Afraz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tfm110/{size}/197758_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33804,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions/505922/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3730621,"name":"Kiet Chau","username":"kiettyyyy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kiettyyyy/{size}/194009_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-04T01:59:51.171Z","cooked":"
DavidMasin:

understood that 2.4GHz doesn’t go away for now.

By popular demand, 2.4 GHz is going away! (just kidding)

The dip switch doesn’t do anything anymore.

We’re going to have another release for the 2.0.0 beta. It’ll be available soon.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-09-04T01:59:51.171Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":169,"readers_count":168,"score":148.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":505922,"topic_slug":"vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions","display_username":"Kiet Chau","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":"Vivid-Hosting","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/5/0/50d2e846f0add7aa9489092abe0f436644dde98d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":62,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CEO @ Vivid-Hosting, Mentor @ Team 1538 / The Holy Cows"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions/505922/7","custom_user_title":"CEO @ Vivid-Hosting, Mentor @ Team 1538 / The Holy Cows","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3730628,"name":"Tauseef Afraz","username":"TFM110","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tfm110/{size}/197758_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-04T02:07:08.189Z","cooked":"
kiettyyyy:

The dip switch doesn’t do anything anymore.

Is there a plan for a new revision of the VH-109 with only 2 dip switches instead of 3?

Also, if a team were to download the beta and install it to the radio, then would go to an offseason, would the kiosk “downgrade” the firmware to 1.3.0?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-09-04T02:09:22.816Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":164,"readers_count":163,"score":42.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":505922,"topic_slug":"vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions","display_username":"Tauseef Afraz","primary_group_name":"Swyft-Robotics","flair_name":"FUN","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/3/5/3523e759b0af37a7757142a8b2aa79b31f1a47c4.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":60,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39084,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC5431AM | FRC5790M| FUN | SWYFT"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions/505922/8","custom_user_title":"FRC5431AM | FRC5790M| FUN | SWYFT","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3730641,"name":"Kiet Chau","username":"kiettyyyy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kiettyyyy/{size}/194009_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-04T02:26:49.872Z","cooked":"
TFM110:

Is there a plan for a new revision of the VH-109 with only 2 dip switches instead of 3?

Why not 0?

TFM110:

would the kiosk “downgrade” the firmware to 1.3.0?

It would not. There will be events that will require 2.0.0

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-09-04T02:26:49.872Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":153,"readers_count":152,"score":120.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":505922,"topic_slug":"vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions","display_username":"Kiet Chau","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":"Vivid-Hosting","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/5/0/50d2e846f0add7aa9489092abe0f436644dde98d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":62,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CEO @ Vivid-Hosting, Mentor @ Team 1538 / The Holy Cows"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions/505922/9","custom_user_title":"CEO @ Vivid-Hosting, Mentor @ Team 1538 / The Holy Cows","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"open_mouth","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"thinking","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3730777,"name":"David","username":"DavidMasin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/davidmasin/{size}/205339_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-04T06:22:44.599Z","cooked":"
kiettyyyy:

By popular demand, 2.4 GHz is going away! (just kidding)

I said “for now” because I was thinking that someday, the radio will go from 2.4 GHz to 5GHz as the “1 radio solution for home practice” (We use the 2 radios setup all of the time and it works great, but I believe some teams doesnt have the setup/2 radios)

Most (and I believe the all laptops will be able to connect to a 5GHz AP) laptops can connect to a 5GHz network and its much faster than the 2.4GHz AP. Its almost as good as 6GHz.

I’m no networking person, so maybe I’m just hallucinating.

kiettyyyy:

Why not 0?

I usually think it’s best to move buttons and switches from physical to digital. But in this case, isn’t it a bit risky that you won’t be able to tell if PoE is enabled?

Just imagine this scenario:
We build a robot and use the PoE feature to power a device. Later, when we disassemble the electronics, we carefully pack everything into organized boxes so nothing gets lost. Now, when building a new robot, we might connect devices that don’t support PoE — and if PoE is still enabled, it could damage them.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-09-04T06:30:01.384Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":2,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":135,"readers_count":134,"score":72.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":505922,"topic_slug":"vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions","display_username":"David","primary_group_name":"FUN","flair_name":"FUN","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/3/5/3523e759b0af37a7757142a8b2aa79b31f1a47c4.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":60,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52686,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions/505922/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3730780,"name":"bobbysq","username":"bobbysq","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bobbysq/{size}/195893_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-04T06:59:11.413Z","cooked":"
DavidMasin:

I usually think it’s best to move buttons and switches from physical to digital. But in this case, isn’t it a bit risky that you won’t be able to tell if PoE is enabled?

I read that as implying that the feature is being dropped entirely. Since Limelight isn’t using it anymore, I don’t think it has much of a reason to exist at this point.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-09-04T06:59:11.413Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":127,"readers_count":126,"score":60.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":505922,"topic_slug":"vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions","display_username":"bobbysq","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28014,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"he/him"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions/505922/11","custom_user_title":"he/him","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3730806,"name":"Scott W","username":"Programming4907","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/programming4907/{size}/168313_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-04T11:10:58.078Z","cooked":"

I think the problem is that FCC regulations won’t allow WiFi 6 access points on a mobile platform, like the robot. I could be wrong. But the VH-109 radio can apparently tell if it’s being powered by a battery (on the robot) or by a wall power supply (like at your practice driver station) and it can only operate in WiFi 6 AP mode if it’s the latter.

So the only one-radio solution for now is the 2.4 GHz AP.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-09-04T11:11:40.680Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":118,"readers_count":117,"score":33.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":505922,"topic_slug":"vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions","display_username":"Scott W","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52686,"username":"DavidMasin","name":"David","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/davidmasin/{size}/205339_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50699,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-2-0-0-beta-some-questions/505922/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3730807,"name":"David","username":"DavidMasin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/davidmasin/{size}/205339_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-04T11:24:43.728Z","cooked":"

I know about the US law against battery powered 6 GHz AP.
I’m not suggesting making the 6GHz a “visible” AP, that would be illegal in the US.

I’m suggesting replacing the 2.4 GHz with 5 GHz. Every device I own can be a 5GHz AP (even my laptop), therefore I dont believe its against regulation (And every smartphone 2020+ can be an access point in 5GHz (Hot Spot)).

The main reason 2.4 GHz radio exists is because it’s on the same chipset as the 6 GHz apps processor & was a “free” addition. Adding 5 GHz would require more HW & likely increase the price. I doubt that change would happen anytime in the near future.

Relevant thread: What if 6GHZ prohibited by local legistaltion? - #10 by kiettyyyy
